title: The Ultimate Exam Day Checklist: 5 Things You Must Remember (Jan ’26 Edition)
summry: Table of Contents 1. The "Must-Carry" Document Bag 2. Stationery Hacks (The "Field Experience") 3. The "Survival Kit" (Non-Obvious Essentials) 4. The Mentor’s Take:…
content:
1. The “Must-Carry” Document Bag

Do not leave this for Monday morning. Pack this bag tonight.

  • Admit Card (Physical Copy): Print two copies. Keep both in your bag, one for use and the other as a backup. Do not rely on your phone; phones are deposited outside.
  • Government ID: Aadhar Card, Voter ID, or Driving License. The name must match your Admit Card.
  • Two Passport Size Photos: Sometimes, the photo on the printed Admit Card is blurry. Invigilators can be fussy. Carry spares just in case.

2. Stationery Hacks (The “Field Experience”)

You aren’t just writing an exam; you are fighting a battle against time. Your weapons matter.

  • Calculators (Yes, Plural): Carry two calculators of the same model.
    • Why? We have seen batteries die in the middle of an SFM paper. It is a nightmare you don’t want to live.
    • Tip: Ensure you are comfortable with the keys. Don’t buy a brand-new model today that feels foreign to your fingers.
  • Black Ballpoint Pens: ICAI is strict about this. No blue, no gel.
    • Mentor’s Take: Do not take a fresh packet of pens. Take pens that are 80% full. They write smoother and don’t blot.
  • Pencil & Eraser: For MCQs and ruling formats.

3. The “Survival Kit” (Non-Obvious Essentials)

This is where the advice comes in. These items save you from unnecessary stress.

  • Transparent Water Bottle: Most centres now strictly forbid non-transparent bottles. If you have a fancy metal flask, they will make you leave it outside. Buy a generic clear plastic bottle.
  • Analog Watch: Smartwatches are strictly banned. Wall clocks in exam centres are notoriously unreliable or positioned where you can’t see them. Wear a simple analog watch to track your 15-minute reading time.
  • The Jacket/Sweater: “But it’s January!” Exactly. But also, some centres have ACs blasting or drafty windows. Shivering while trying to balance a Balance Sheet is impossible. Layer up.

4. The Mentor’s Take: The “1:45 PM” Strategy

The most crucial 15 minutes of your life.

When you get that paper at 1:45 PM (for the 2:00 PM start), your heart will race.

  1. Don’t read Question 1 first. It is usually the toughest and is designed to panic you.
  2. Scan the paper for the “Easy Kill” questions.
  3. Plan your order of attack.

A Note on Anxiety:
If you feel overwhelmed, remember why you started. Visualise the end goal. Visualise yourself two months from now, using the Salary Estimator to negotiate your first package, or updating your profile on our Resume Builder with those two magical letters “CA” before your name. Keep that image in your head.

5. Last Minute Advice: 1 Hour Before

  • Stop Studying: at 1:00 PM, close the book. Cramming now only overwrites what you stored in your long-term memory.
  • Avoid the “Discussion Circle”: You know that group of students outside the centre discussing “Is AS-11 important?” Stay away from them. They radiate panic. Put on your headphones.
  • Hydrate, but not too much: You don’t want bathroom breaks eating into your writing time.

Conclusion

You have done the work. Now, trust your preparation. Whether this is your first attempt or you are fighting back after a setback, remember that this exam tests your nerves as much as your knowledge.

Good luck for Jan 5th. You’ve got this!

content:
If you’re a CA fresher, a semi-qualified professional, or even someone stuck in a hectic 9–9 audit routine, you’ve probably dreamed about flexible work. And now that remote finance roles have exploded post-2024, remote chartered accountant jobs in India are no longer rare or restricted to startups.

By 2026, remote finance hiring has become mainstream in Big 4, global MNCs, investment banking back offices, tax consultancies, and even UAE/US firms hiring Indian CAs to work from home.

This guide is everything you need: the roles, salaries, day-to-day life, skills needed, which companies hire, pros & cons, real-life scenarios, and a practical roadmap to land remote jobs for chartered accountants in India.

Let’s get right into it.

Top Remote Chartered Accountant Jobs in India in 2026

Below are the most in-demand remote finance roles that CAs in India are taking up in 2026-with honest clarity on what the job actually looks like.

1. Remote Financial Analyst (FP&A)

This is one of the most popular remote chartered accountant jobs because FP&A doesn’t require physical audits or site visits. You’ll work with the CFO team, forecasting numbers, preparing dashboards, and analyzing financial health.

Day-to-Day Work

  • Creating monthly budgeting files
  • Analysing variances vs forecast
  • Preparing MIS reports
  • Building models for revenue, cost, and cash flow
  • Presenting insights to business leaders

title: Modern Accounting Practices in India: How Digital Tools Are Transforming Businesses
summry: The accounting landscape in India is undergoing a significant transformation, driven by the adoption of digital tools and artificial intelligence (AI). In recent years, businesses have increasingly…
content:
Written by Sakshi jain Dt. October 10th, 2025

The accounting landscape in India is undergoing a significant transformation, driven by the adoption of digital tools and artificial intelligence (AI). In recent years, businesses have increasingly turned to digital accounting software to streamline their financial operations, improve accuracy, and reduce costs.

The Rise of AI in Accounting and Finance in India
AI-powered accounting tools are revolutionising the way businesses manage their finances. These tools can automate tasks such as data entry, invoicing, and reconciliation, freeing up accountants to focus on higher-value tasks like financial analysis and planning. AI algorithms can also help detect anomalies and predict future trends, enabling businesses to make informed decisions.

Benefits of Digital Accounting Software in India
Digital accounting software offers numerous benefits to businesses in India, including:

  • Improved accuracy: Automated processes reduce the risk of human error, ensuring accurate financial records.
  • Increased efficiency: Digital tools streamline financial operations, saving time and reducing costs.
  • Enhanced compliance: Digital accounting software helps businesses comply with regulatory requirements, such as GST and income tax.
  • Better decision-making: Real-time financial insights enable businesses to make informed decisions and drive growth.
    • Popular Digital Accounting Software in India
      Some popular digital accounting software used in India includes:
  • Tally: A widely used accounting software that offers features like GST compliance and inventory management.
  • Zoho Books: A cloud-based accounting software that offers features like automated invoicing and expense tracking.
  •  QuickBooks: A popular accounting software that offers features like financial reporting and budgeting.
    • Conclusion
    • The adoption of digital tools and AI in accounting and finance is transforming the way businesses operate in India. By leveraging these tools, businesses can improve their financial management, reduce costs, and drive growth. As the accounting landscape continues to evolve, it’s essential for businesses to stay ahead of the curve and adopt modern accounting practices.
